New Records: LeBron James recorded a triple-double with 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists, and Anthony Davis scored 31 points and nine rebounds to lead the Lakers to a 131-127 victory over the Kings.
Key Match Events: James made a long 3-pointer in the fourth quarter, capping an 8-0 run to give the Lakers a 101-94 lead, and Davis made a big 3-pointer with 37 seconds left to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers were undefeated at 3-0 under new coach JJ Redick, and Davis had scored at least 31 points in each game this season.
Post-Match Reflections: All five Kings starters scored in double figures, showcasing a balanced effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: James' triple-double marked his 22nd such performance in the NBA, highlighting his continued impact despite his years of experience.
Others: The game was the latest in a strong start for the Lakers under Redick, and the Kings prepared for their next game against the Trail Blazers.
